definition[0]: the upper part of your legs when you are sitting down
example[0]: Shannon sat on her mother’s lap.
example[1]: His hands were folded in his lap.
definition[1]: a single journey around a race track
example[2]: Rubens Barrichello finished a lap ahead of his team-mate.
example[3]: The entire team took a victory lap in front of their cheering fans.
definition[2]: a single journey from one end of a swimming pool to another
example[4]: Every morning she swims 50 laps in the pool.
definition[3]: a part of a long journey
example[5]: The last lap of their journey was by ship.
definition[4]: if water laps something or laps against something such as the shore or a boat, it moves against it or hits it in small waves
example[6]: The tide was lapping the harbour wall.
example[7]: The waves lapped gently against the rocks.
definition[5]: if an animal laps water, milk etc, it drinks it by putting its tongue into it
definition[6]: to pass a competitor in a race who is one complete lap behind you
example[8]: Erik Gomas spun off the track when trying to lap Andrew Scott.
